intro: Hesperonia cedrosensis, commonly known as the Cedros Island hesperonia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cedros in the Gulf of California. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and coastal environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
